Package org.wmn4j.notation.elements

Class Note

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wmn4j.notation.elements.Note
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Durational, Pitched
    public final class Note
extends java.lang.Object
implements Durational, Pitched
    Represents a note. This class is immutable. Notes have pitch, duration, articulations, and can be tied. A sequence of tied notes functions like a singly linked list where a previous note keeps track of the following tied note.

      • getNote

        public static Note getNote​(Pitch.Base pitchName,
                           int alter,
                           int octave,
                           Duration duration)
        Returns an instance with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        pitchName - the letter part of the pitch name
        alter - how many half-steps the pitch is altered up (positive) or down (negative)
        octave - octave number of the pitch
        duration - the duration of the note. Must not be null
        Returns:
        an instance with the given parameters

        public static Note getNote​(Pitch pitch,
                           Duration duration,
                           java.util.Set<Articulation> articulations,

                           Note tiedTo,

        pitch - the pitch of the note
        duration - the duration of the note
        articulations - a set of Articulations associated with the note
        multiNoteArticulations - list of the MultiNoteArticulations for the note
        tiedTo - the following note to which this is tied
        isTiedFromPrevious - true if this is tied from the previous note

        an instance with the given parameters

      • getMultiNoteArticulations

        public java.util.List<MultiNoteArticulation> getMultiNoteArticulations()
        Returns the multinote articulations defined for this note. These are articulations such as slurs or glissando.
        Returns:
        the multinote articulations defined for this note

      • getTiedDuration

        public Duration getTiedDuration()
        Returns the total duration of tied notes starting from the onset of this note. For example, if three quarter notes are tied together, then the tied duration of the first note is a dotted half note. For a note that is not tied to a following note this is equal to the note's duration.
        Returns:
        the total duration of tied notes starting from the onset of this note

      • getFollowingTiedNote

        public java.util.Optional<Note> getFollowingTiedNote()
        Returns the following note to which this note is tied. If this note is not tied to a following note, then returns empty.
        Returns:
        the following note to which this note is tied

      • compareByPitch

        public int compareByPitch​(Note other)
        Returns an integer that specifies if this note is higher than, lower than, or equal in pitch to the given note.
        Parameters:
        other - the note to which this is compared for pitch
        Returns:
        negative integer if this note is lower than other, positive integer if this is higher than other, 0 if notes are (enharmonically) of same height.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if this note is equal to the given object. Notes are equal if they have the same pitch, duration, and set of articulations.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the Object with which this Note is compared for equality
        Returns:
        true if Object o is of class Note and has the same Pitch, Duration, and Articulations as this Node. false otherwise
